title: SDS on the democratic system - pov

content.description:
"We are people of this generation, bred in at least modest comfort, housed now in universities.... Freedom and equality for each individual, government of, by, and for the people—these American values we found good.... As we grew,however,our comfort was penetrated by events too troubling to dismiss.... The declaration ‘all men are created equal’ rang hollow before the facts of Negro life.... The proclaimed peaceful intentions of the United States contradicted its economic and military investments in the Cold War status quo.... America rests in national stalemate,...its democratic system apathetic and manipulated rather than ‘of, by, and for the people.’”

Students for a Democratic Society, “The Port Huron Statement,” 1962
content.question: Based on the excerpt, Students for a Democratic Society would most likely support

choices.label: greater global economic integration under United States leadership
expanded attempts to repress communists in the United States
a decrease in United States intervention in Asia
reduced spending for government social programs

content.answer: a decrease in United States intervention in Asia

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
